w:r.w:t: from QB2 using texture, shape, size, NDVI)
Digitized water bodies and channels for spatial queries
Green vegetation endmember fractions in ESRI .grid format; from 20051028 scene subset
Non-photosynthetic vegetation endmember fractions in ESRI .grid format; from 20051028 scene subset
Shade endmember fractions in ESRI .grid format; from 20051028 scene subset
Segmented units classified with Land Cover Classification System; has
=proportion of segmented unit that is covered by woody vegetation
Class name corresponding to dominant lifeform classifier
Designation based on LCCS cover classifier (Sparse (4-1%), Sparse (5-9%), Open (10-40%), Open (40-70%), Closed (70

Individual woody vegetation polygon features with extracted endmember fractions (green vegetation, non-photosynthetic vegetation, shade) as well as fraction index and 3 experimental fields used to evaluate fraction thresholds.
fractions averaged from 20051028 Landsat 5 TM scene
= shade endmember fractions averaged from 20051028 Landsat 5 TM scene
= green vegetation endmember fractions averaged from 20051028 Landsat 5 TM scene
= area of individual woody vegetation polygons (used to calculate percent of woody vegetation cover within segmented units)
= experimental fields used to evaluate possible endmember fraction thresholds in relation to dominant lifeform. Did not use in final classification.
= LCCS code for dominant lifeform classifier
= LCCS name for dominant lifeform classifier
= result of weighted endmember fraction index
Polygon feature class used to mask out areas that are not of interest (not in floodplain, not vegetated). Mask was generated by unsupervised classification of
mosaic where vegetated classes were exported as ESRI
. Used to clip data for use in

Polygon feature class at segmented unit level that contains extracted endmember fractions from Multiple Endmember SMA. MESMA fractions generated using same library collected by J. Isherwood. Unprocessed MESMA results also included outside of file geodatabase.
= Landsat 5 TM pixels that intersect individual segmented unit
= average shade fraction within segmented unit
= variance of shade fraction within segmented unit
= average sand fraction within segmented unit
= variance of sand fraction within segmented unit
= variance of non-photosynthetic fraction within segmented unit
= average green vegetation fraction within segmented unit
= variance of green vegetation fraction within segmented unit
Table that stores MESMA endmember fractions extracted at woody vegetation level. Can be joined to woody vegetation features.
= average non-photosynthetic vegetation endmember fraction within woody vegetation feature
= average green vegetation endmember fraction within woody vegetation feature
= count of Landsat 5 TM pixels that intersected with the woody vegetation feature
= unique ID field used to join to FID of woody vegetation features (_
Table that stores manually interpreted validation segmented units and lifeform classification based on MESMA fractions. Can join to
= unique ID field used to join to FID of
coded value for manually interpreted cover (0=sparse, 1=open, 2=closed)
= coded value for manually interpreted dominant lifeform
= coded value for single model SMA endmember fraction classification for cover (0=sparse, 1=open, 2=closed). This clas
sification was determined by the proportion of a segmented unit that woody vegetation covers (independent of fraction differences).
= coded value for single model SMA endmember fraction classification for dominant lifeform (0=shrub, 1=tree, 2=herbaceous)
= coded value for single model SMA endmember fraction classification for dominant lifeform (0=shrub, 1=tree)
Point feature class of segmented unit centroids used to assess accuracy of LCCS classification.
= percent of segmented unit covered by woody vegetation (cover)
= name of LCCS dominant lifeform class; manually interpreted from
= name of LCCS cover class; manually interpreted from
= points added in 2 rounds to increase sample size for each unique class combination
= coded value for cover classifier (0=sparse, 1=open, 2=closed) ; manually interpreted from
= coded value for dominant lifeform classifier (0=herbaceous, 1=shrub, 2=tree) ; manually interpreted from
= Unique identifier for corresponding segmented unit. Use to join to segmented unit polygon.
= coded value for dominant lifeform classification (0=herbaceous, 1=shrub, 2=tree)
= LCCS code for cover classifier class (A12= closed (70
= LCCS code for dominant lifeform classifier class (A2= herbaceous, A3= trees, A4=shrubs)
= name of LCCS cover class; from hierarchical object-based classification
= name of LCCS dominant lifeform class from hierarchical object-based classification
agreement in manually interpreted reference and hierarchical object-based classification; 0= disagreement, 1=agreement
agreement in manually interpreted reference and hierarchical object-based classification; 0= disagreement, 1=agreement
Point feature class used to assess the accuracy of the woody vegetation classification. Contains 5,000 points, 425 points are non-woody vegetation/
= binary field indicating manually interpreted presence of woody vegetation (0=woody vegetation absent, 1= woody vegetation present)
Point feature class storing Landsat VCF values to manually interpreted cover for segmented units.
=area of segmented unit in square meters
=manually interpreted dominant lifeform for segmented unit
=manually interpreted woody vegetation cover for segmented unit
=binary field for agreement between reference cover and mean VCF tree cover (
0=disagreement in class (sparse, open, closed) between reference woody vegetation cover and mean tree cover from VCF,
between reference woody vegetation cover and mean tree cover from VCF
= coded value for cover using VCF tree cover (0=sparse, 1=open, 2=closed)
= coded value for cover using woody vegetation cover classification (0=sparse, 1=open, 2=closed)

Table storing tree cover (canopy cover*0.8) from Landsat VCF 2005 and classification-based woody vegetation cover for segmented units classified as dominantly herbaceous (e.g., sparse woody vegetation cover).
= coded value for dominant lifeform classifier (0=herbaceous)
= proportion of segmented unit covered by classified woody vegetation
= area in square meters of the segmented unit
=mean VCF tree cover within segmented unit
=minimum VCF tree cover cell within segmented unit
=maximum VCF tree cover cell within segmented unit
=mean of error reported with Landsat VCF product within segmented unit
=standard deviation of error reported within segmented unit
=calculated area of VCF cells within segmented unit
=range in tree cover values of VCF cells within segmented unit
= count of unique tree cover values of VCF cells within segmented unit
= median of tree cover of VCF cells within segmented unit
Table storing tree cover (canopy cover*0.8) from Landsat VCF 2005 and classification-based woody vegetation cover for segmented units classified as dominated by shrubs.
= coded value for dominant lifeform classifier (1=shrub)
= proportion of segmented unit covered by classified woody vegetation
= area in square meters of the segmented unit
=mean VCF tree cover within segmented unit
=minimum VCF tree cover cell within segmented unit
=maximum VCF tree cover cell within segmented unit
=mean of error reported with Landsat VCF product within segmented unit
=standard deviation of error reported within segmented unit
=calculated area of VCF cells within segmented unit
=range in tree cover values of VCF cells within segmented unit
= count of unique tree cover values of VCF cells within segmented unit
= median of tree cover of VCF cells within segmented unit
Table storing tree cover (canopy cover*0.8) from Landsat VCF 2005 and classification-based woody vegetation cover for segmented units classified as dominat
= coded value for dominant lifeform classifier (2=tree)
= proportion of segmented unit covered by classified woody vegetation
= area in square meters of the segmented unit
=mean VCF tree cover within segmented unit
=minimum VCF tree cover cell within segmented unit
=maximum VCF tree cover cell within segmented unit
=mean of error reported with Landsat VCF product within segmented unit
